metadata.titel_preek: Pergamos: The Church Near Satan's Throne, Part 2

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from worldly obscurity and cultural compromise to divine recognition and acquittal through faithfulness to Jesus Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: May each of one you be an Antipas.
You can pay the price of service to Jesus Christ.
If you're faithful, if you will try to do your best, I will give you acquittal.

object.identificatie: The 'White Stone' (Acquittal, Recognition, and Eternal Security)
tekstueel_bewijs: I will give you acquittal. Not guilty!
It was their lifetime pass into the games.
The spirit of the risen Lord said...
The Lord here is saying, 'I will give you...'
To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject who must 'overcome' to become the Receiver.

helper.identificatie: The Memory of the Saints / The Preacher's Warning
tekstueel_bewijs: People who inspired your life by their own example.
I do not stand here... to speak to you quietly... Repent!
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender/Judge; Jesus is the source of the Object, but the 'doing' is largely the Subject's responsibility.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (the Spirit's voice as a sharp word).

tekstueel_bewijs: The world wants us for what we can give... they are through.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily the pressure to assimilate into the surrounding culture or political systems.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preservation of the Church's integrity against secular/political capture.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (as a corporate body)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The individual's faithfulness (Primary) is the building block for the Church's standing (Secondary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Examples of Saints → The Hearer ← Cultural Compromise

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord Jesus himself has in the fifth verse...
The Lord's hand is removed from that place.
The Judge of all the earth has acquitted me.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You can pay the price of service.
You might want to change it.
If you will try to do your best.

voorbeelden: There must be some line of demarcation.
No church ought merely be a spokesperson.
How they sought to serve the Lord Jesus.
I have not the time this morning to go into all that Balaam did.
You can pay the price of service.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily imperative. It focuses on the obligation (Devoir) of the believer to maintain a 'line of demarcation' and the necessity of repentance.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the threat of S2 (Judgment/Fire) to the demand for ~S1 (Repentance) to reach S1 (Acquittal).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'White Stone' given by the Judge, though it is conditioned on 'trying to do your best'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The metaphor of the house on fire and the 'sharp cutting' word of the Lord takes judgment seriously.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon ends with a powerful declaration of grace ('I am not guilty because the Judge acquitted me'), the narrative engine is driven by human effort and the 'price of service'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I will give you, if you're faithful, if you will try to do your best, I will give you acquittal.
Remember people who inspired your life by their own example... May each of one you be an Antipas.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Not because I have been found innocent, but I am not guilty... I sign it in my blood.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Antipas and the 'simple people' from the preacher's past are used as models of faithfulness for the hearer to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ as the 'Faithful Witness' who sustains His church even where Satan's throne is.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform and 'pay the price' to ensure a lasting reputation and divine acquittal.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God's acquittal is the response to human faithfulness.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: There is a tension between the 'free gift' of the white stone and the 'price of service' required to get it.
spanning_punten: The 'white stone' is both a gift to the faithful and something one must 'try to do your best' to receive.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I sign it in my blood. You're free.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the one who convicts and warns ('The Spirit said... Repent!').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment narrative, urging the hearer to take up the role of 'Faithful Witness' to earn a 'New Name'.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject of 'paying the price' and 'standing up to life'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who holds the church in His hand.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You can pay the price of service,' use 'Christ has paid the price so that you are now free to serve.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Antipas's faithfulness was a fruit of Christ's power, not his own 'best effort'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Hidden Manna' provides the strength to resist the 'Doctrine of Balaam'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (cultural capture) is well-defined and serious.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The preacher successfully identifies the gravity of the 'throne of Satan'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics/Service) often precedes or conditions the 'Primary Program' (Salvation).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the Acquittal (White Stone) as the foundation that enables the Service (Antipas-role).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful rhetorical finish, but the underlying structure risks making grace a reward for the 'faithful' rather than a gift for the 'foul'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the vivid metaphors (orange juice, fire); Greimas reveals the conditional 'if' that undermines the grace-language.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Nicolaitans; Greimas shows they function as the 'Opponent' to the Subject's 'Object' of purity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that while the preacher says 'Free!', the actantial structure says 'Earn it by being like Antipas'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses strong 'Law' to drive the hearer toward 'Gospel', but the Gospel is framed as a reward for those who heed the Law.
